fields.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Used to inactivate an existing Catalog or Supplier Item

Effective date for the UOM. For Supplier items, this field can be updated at anytime, but for Catalog Items, this field can only be updated when you enable catalog data and pricing for your purchase items.

Select to calculate price for Ordering and Just in Time UOMs based on the price entered for the Default Unit of Measure. When advanced pricing applies to a transaction with an undefined UOM, we calculate the price based on the conversion factor of the price rule. This enables you to load 1 price for 1 UOM.

JIT UOM Data for Catalog or Supplier Item.
Pricing History cannot be updated.
Supplier specific Advanced Pricing rule. Can be an update of existing rule or a new one.

We return all purchase items associated with the supplier you enter. We also return all the information set up for the purchase item, including supplier information for all associated suppliers.. Supports multiple values.

Reference to an existing Purchase Item Group.  Assign purchase items to item groups to make it easier to search for and select items. Purchase items can belong to multiple groups.. Supports multiple values.

Select Yes to return all advance prices. When you don't select this and you don't enter an effective date, we return advance prices that are effective at the time this web service runs. When you don't select this and you enter an effective date, then we return prices that are active for the effective date entered.
Only retrieve Supplier Items considered active (that have active unit of measure pricing information.)

Select to exclude pricing that’s calculated based on the conversion factor. When you enable Calculate Price based on Conversion Factor, Workday only returns pricing that is not calculated based on the conversion factor and the also the default price. This enables you to quickly view and edit relevant pricing.
Select a date to return purchase items edited after this time.
Select a date to return purchase items edited before this time.
Select one or more purchase item statuses to return purchase items with the specified statuses.. Supports multiple values.
Select one or more purchase item statuses to return purchase items with the specified statuses.. Supports multiple values.

Advanced_Pricing_Data.description: Supplier specific Advanced Pricing rule. Can be an update of existing rule or a new one.

Calculate_Price_based_on_Conversion_Fact.description: Select to calculate price for Ordering and Just in Time UOMs based on the price entered for the Default Unit of Measure. When advanced pricing applies to a transaction with an undefined UOM, we calculate the price based on the conversion factor of the price rule. This enables you to load 1 price for 1 UOM.

Currency_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Exclude_Pricing_Calculated_by_Conversion.description: Select to exclude pricing that’s calculated based on the conversion factor. When you enable Calculate Price based on Conversion Factor, Workday only returns pricing that is not calculated based on the conversion factor and the also the default price. This enables you to quickly view and edit relevant pricing.

ID.description: Reference ID for the Supplier Item.

Inactive.description: Used to inactivate an existing Catalog or Supplier Item

Item_Group_Reference_Purchase_Item_Group.description: Reference to an existing Purchase Item Group.  Assign purchase items to item groups to make it easier to search for and select items. Purchase items can belong to multiple groups.. Supports multiple values.

Item_Group_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Reference to an existing Purchase Item Group.  Assign purchase items to item groups to make it easier to search for and select items. Purchase items can belong to multiple groups.. Supports multiple values.

Item_Updated_From_Prompt.description: Select a date to return purchase items edited after this time.

Lead_Time.description: Catalog or Supplier Item Lead Time

Packaging_String.description: Packaging String for Catalog Item linked to Purchase Item. Solely used for the Get operation (not the Put operation).

Pricing_Effective_Date.description: Effective date for the UOM. For Supplier items, this field can be updated at anytime, but for Catalog Items, this field can only be updated when you enable catalog data and pricing for your purchase items.

PurchaseItem_Purchase_Item_Reference_WID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Return_Active_Advanced_Pricing_Prompt.description: Only retrieve Supplier Items considered active (that have active unit of measure pricing information.)

Return_All_Advanced_Pricing_Prompt.description: Select Yes to return all advance prices. When you don't select this and you don't enter an effective date, we return advance prices that are effective at the time this web service runs. When you don't select this and you enter an effective date, then we return prices that are active for the effective date entered.

Sourcing_Priority.description: Sourcing Priority of the Catalog Item.

Supplier_Contract_Reference.description: Supplier contract(s) for the Catalog or Supplier item
